title: Calories in a Cheesecake Slice
meta_description: Discover calories in a cheesecake slice, including macros like fat, carbs, protein, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Standard New York-style cheesecake slice (1/8 of 9-inch cake, ~120g), baked with cream cheese, eggs, sugar, graham cracker crust; no toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, and toppings; homemade or store-bought differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheesecake contains ~400 kcal, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Low-fat version (reduced cream cheese and crust)
Add strawberry topping (2 tbsp fruit and sauce)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cheesecake slice?
faqs.a: About 400 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a slice of cheesecake?
faqs.a: Around 28 g total fat, including 15 g saturated fat.
Yes, ~30 g carbs per slice, with 20 g sugars and minimal fiber.

faqs.q: How much protein in a cheesecake slice?
Does cheesecake slice size affect calories?
faqs.a: Yes; larger slices (e.g., 150g) can reach 500+ kcal, smaller ones less.
